snippet: Hostess Brands moved to wind down operations. | A report faulted MF Global regulators. | European bank debt is, surprisingly, selling. | A trial opened in a $68 million insider trading case. | And Andrew Ross Sorkin prescribed a dose of realism for...
abstract: Hostess Brands moved to wind down operations. | A report faulted MF Global regulators. | European bank debt is, surprisingly, selling. | A trial opened in a $68 million insider trading case. | And Andrew Ross Sorkin prescribed a dose of realism for the chief of J.C. Penney. | A look back on our reporting of the last week's highs and lows in finance.

headline.main: Week in Review: It May Be Twilight for Twinkies
